00047 fsal_status_t FSAL_readlink(
00048     fsal_handle_t         * p_linkhandle,     /* IN */
00049     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00050     fsal_path_t           * p_link_content, /* OUT */
00051     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_link_attributes /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00052 ){
00053 
00054   int rc, errsv;
00055   fsal_status_t status;
00056   char link_content_out[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00057   fsal_path_t               fsalpath;
00058   int                       count;
00059 
00060  /* sanity checks.
00061   * note : link_attributes is optional.
00062   */
00063   if (!p_linkhandle || !p_context || !p_link_content)
00064     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00065     
00066   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_linkhandle, 0, &fsalpath, NULL);
00067   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00068   
00069   memset(link_content_out, 0, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00070   
00071   /* Read the link on the filesystem */
00072   
00073   TakeTokenFSCall();
00074   rc = readlink(fsalpath.path, link_content_out, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00075   errsv = errno;
00076   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00077   
00078   /* rc is the length for the symlink content or -1 on error !!! */  
00079   if (rc<0)
00080     Return( posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00081     
00082   /* convert char * to fsal_path_t */
00083   
00084   status = FSAL_str2path(link_content_out, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, p_link_content);
00085   
00086   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00087     Return(status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00088     
00089   
00090   /* retrieves object attributes, if asked */
00091   
00092   if ( p_link_attributes ){
00093     
00094     status = FSAL_getattrs( p_linkhandle, p_context , p_link_attributes );
00095     
00096     /* On error, we set a flag in the returned attributes */
00097     
00098     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00099     {
00100       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00101       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00102           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00103     }
00104     
00105   }
00106   
00107   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_readlink );
00108   
00109   
00110 }

00113 
00143 fsal_status_t FSAL_symlink(
00144     fsal_handle_t         * p_parent_directory_handle,    /* IN */
00145     fsal_name_t           * p_linkname,                 /* IN */
00146     fsal_path_t           * p_linkcontent,              /* IN */
00147     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00148     fsal_accessmode_t       accessmode,                 /* IN (ignored) */
00149     fsal_handle_t         * p_link_handle,                /* OUT */
00150     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_link_attributes             /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00151 ){
00152 
00153   int rc, errsv;
00154   fsal_status_t status;
00155   fsal_path_t   fsalpath;
00156   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t infofs;
00157   struct stat buffstat;
00158   
00159   /* sanity checks.
00160    * note : link_attributes is optional.
00161    */
00162   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle || 
00163        !p_context   ||
00164        !p_link_handle ||
00165        !p_linkname  ||
00166        !p_linkcontent )
00167     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00168   
00169   /* Tests if symlinking is allowed by configuration. */
00170   
00171   if ( !global_fs_info.symlink_support )
00172       Return( ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP, 0,INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00173 
00174   
00175   /* build the new path and check the permissions on the parent directory */
00176   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00177   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00178   
00179   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00180   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00181   
00182   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_linkname);
00183   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00184   
00185   /* create the symlink on the filesystem. */
00186   
00187   TakeTokenFSCall();
00188   rc = symlink(p_linkcontent->path, fsalpath.path);
00189   errsv = errno;
00190   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00191 
00192   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00193 
00194   /* stat the file & add it to the database */ 
00195   TakeTokenFSCall();
00196   rc = lstat( fsalpath.path, &buffstat );
00197   errsv = errno;
00198   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00199 
00200   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00201 
00202   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &infofs) ) )
00203     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00204   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_linkname, &infofs, p_parent_directory_handle, p_link_handle)))
00205     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00206   
00207   /* chown the symlink to the current user */
00208 
00209   TakeTokenFSCall();
00210   rc = lchown(fsalpath.path, p_context->credential.user, -1);
00211   errsv = errno;
00212   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00213   
00214   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00215 
00216   /* get attributes if asked */
00217   
00218   if ( p_link_attributes ){
00219     
00220     status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat, p_link_attributes );
00221     
00222     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00223     {
00224         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00225         FSAL_SET_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00226             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00227     }
00228     
00229   }
00230   
00231   
00232   /* OK */
00233   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00234 }
